poem:
Title: "Upon Morality in the Glare of Spotlight"

Lone voices rise, iron under glistered sheen,
Cavill and Lumley's battle cry, mustered in silent scene.
A moral cause in nudity's glut decry,
Not all gentility lost, in cinema's sly lie.

Dismantle vulgarity, rein in the bare explicit,
Seek the soul in characters, not their sordid visit.
Above the muck, a head held high, highlights the might,
Of embracing dignity, under the klieg light.
